9.text:
Hi and welcome to this short video clip from
our frequently asked question series brought

13.text:
to you by the car2cover team. In this video
I'll answer the question "What happens to

19.text:
my Gap Insurance if I change my car?"
If you purchase a Return To Invoice or Vehicle

25.text:
Replacement Gap Insurance from car2cover after
1st November 2012 - you have two options available

33.text:
to you.
Firstly, you can transfer the remaining period

37.text:
and level of cover to your next vehicle and
our insurer will do that for you without a

44.text:
charge. When you do this, you must be sure
the remaining period and level of cover is

50.text:
adequate for your next vehicle as policies
cannot be extended or adjusted during a transfer

56.text:
and the policy would not be renewable when
it expires.

60.text:
Your second option option is to simply to
cancel your policy and receive a refund of

65.text:
unused premium less a cancellation fee charged
by the insurer.

70.text:
If you are choosing a Finance and Contract
Hire Gap Insurance after 1st November 2012,

76.text:
please be aware these policies are not transferable. So
-  if you are changing your vehicle and you

83.text:
have a Finance and Contract Hire Gap Insurance,
you can cancel your policy and receive a refund

89.text:
of unused premium less a cancellation fee
charged by the insurer.

95.text:
Policies purchased before 1st November 2012
may or may not be transferable so please refer

102.text:
to your specific policy Terms and Conditions
document for details - or call us for clarification. All

110.text:
policies purchased before 1st November 2012
were not premium refundable, so again, please

116.text:
refer to your policy documents.
I hope you found these answers helpful. If

122.text:
you have any questions - please feel free
to contact us using the details below.

127.text: Thanks for watching and bye for now.
